questions.question: What are the elements involved in the synthesis of the parent anionic phosphanyl- and arsanylborane chains?
What method was used to characterize the compounds containing longer chains of neutral oligophosphinoboranes?
What was the outcome of the reaction between H2P-BH2·NMe3 (1 a) and NaPH2 in THF?
Is the reaction of 1 a or 1 b with the AsH2 unit of 4 thermodynamically favored?
What was the main challenge in transferring compounds 1 a, 2, or 3 into a similar chain as [Na]+[H2As-BH2-PH2-BH2-AsH2]@?
questions.answer: The anionic species are much more sensitive and react readily with solvents, such as acetonitrile, making the transfer challenging.

questions.question: What does the natural population analysis (NPA) reveal about the charge distribution in the chains [H2E-BH2-EH2]@?
questions.answer: The main part of the negative charge is localized on the B atom.

questions.question: True or False: The reaction of H2P-BH2·NMe3 (1 a) with NHCdipp at room temperature resulted in the formation of compound 6.
What was the unexpected product obtained when H2P-BH2·NMe3 (1 a) was refluxed with NHCdipp in toluene?
What structural feature is unique to compound 6 compared to other discussed compounds?
questions.answer: Compound 6 features a cation with a B-P-B unit stabilized by two NHC ligands and an anion built up from alternating BH2 and PH2 units.

questions.question: True or False: The pnictogenylboranes H2E-BH2·NMe3 (1 a: E = P; 1 b: E = As) are not suitable as building blocks for oligomeric and polymeric compounds.
What was the primary focus of the research on the catenation of non-carbon atoms and moieties?
questions.answer: Especially on the catenation of Group 15 elements.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of novel cationic chains of phosphanyl- and arsanylboranes was unsuccessful.
What was the result of sonication of a solution of the phosphanylborane H2P-BH2·NMe3 (1 a) with one equivalent of NaPH2 in THF?
questions.answer: The substitution of NMe3 by PH2@ and the formation of [Na]+[H2P-BH2-PH2]@ (2)

questions.question: True or False: The anionic species [H2E-BH2-EH2]@ described in the text are unstable under inert conditions.
What was the main part of the negative charge localized on in the chains [H2E-BH2-EH2]@ according to the NPA?
True or False: The reaction of H2P-BH2·NMe3 (1 a) with EH2@ leading to [H2P-BH2-EH2]@ is exothermic.
What was the outcome of treating 1 b with NaPH2?
questions.answer: Selective yield of the mixed chain compound [Na]+[H2As-BH2-PH2]@ (4)

questions.question: True or False: The reaction of 1 a with KAsH2 results in a mixture of unconsumed 1 a, 2, and the product 3.
What does the presence of ClBH2·NMe3 as minor impurities in the starting material suggest about the synthesis of compound 6?
questions.answer: It suggests that ClBH2·NMe3 might play a role in the formation of 6, possibly through the generation of a transient H2PBH2 species.

questions.question: True or False: The pnictogenylboranes H2E-BH2·NMe3 are exclusively used for the synthesis of linear anionic chains.
